meanings.definition: To descend a rock face or other near-vertical surface by using a doubled rope coiled around the body and fixed at a higher point.
meanings.sent1: She abseiled down the cliff with caution.
meanings.sent2: The adventurer abseiled down the mountain swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to abseil down the curtains for fun.
meanings.sent4: His confidence abseiled down the drain after the failed attempt.
meanings.sent5: The image of her abseiling down the waterfall stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To descend by means of a rope.
meanings.sent1: They abseiled from the helicopter to the ground below.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters abseiled down the burning building to rescue the trapped people.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to abseil down the tree trunk but got tangled in its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes abseiled down as she struggled to make progress.
meanings.sent5: The idea of abseiling into the unknown excited him.
